title: Giryama (1994) Genesis Portion
description:
KiGiryama is spoken north of Mombasa, in southwestern Kenya. It is a Bantu tongue, closely related to the Nyika dialects, but manifests considerable Swahili influence.

1892 Luke (with Swahili); 1899 John; 1900 Mark; 1908 Romansâ€”Revelation; Acts (revised) 1924 New Testament (revised); 1951 Psalms (revised) New Testament BFBS, London Translated by missionaries of the Church MS, including W. E. Taylor, J. Gona, and D. A. Hooper. Revised by Florence I. Deed.

language.name: Giryama
language.area: Coast Province, Kilifi and Kwale districts, north of Mombasa.
